meanings.definition: The position or rank of a general.
meanings.sent1: In the army, achieving a high generalcy requires dedication and skill.
meanings.sent2: The generalcy of the army was respected by all soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The generalcy of the toy soldiers in the playroom was challenged by the mischievous teddy bear.
meanings.sent4: His generalcy in the office made him a natural leader among his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The generalcy of the lion in the jungle was unquestionable.

meanings.definition: The authority or command of a general.
meanings.sent1: The generalcy of the commander was evident in his decisive orders.
meanings.sent2: The generalcy of the military leader was crucial in times of war.
meanings.sent3: The generalcy of the teacher in the classroom kept the students disciplined.
meanings.sent4: She held the generalcy of the kitchen, making sure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The generalcy of the captain guided the ship through the stormy seas.

meanings.sent1: The generalcy gathered to discuss the upcoming battle strategy.
meanings.sent2: The generalcy met to plan the defense of the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The generalcy enjoyed a friendly game of chess during their break.
meanings.sent4: The generalcy stood united in their decision to support the peace treaty.
meanings.sent5: The generalcy marched together, a formidable force on the battlefield.
